text: Raymond Kennedy (28 July 1951 – 30 November 2021) was an English footballer. Kennedy played as a forward. He scored 148 goals in 581 league and cup appearances in a 15-year career in the English Football League. In an exceptional career he won 12 major trophies .He won 17 caps for England between 1976 and 1980. Kennedy died on 30 November 2021 at his home in New Hartley, England from problems caused by Parkinson's disease, at the age of 70. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season Division League FA Cup Other Total Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Arsenal 1969–70 First Division 4 1 0 0 2 1 6 2 1970–71 First Division 41 19 9 2 13 5 63 26 1971–72 First Division 37 12 8 1 10 6 55 19 1972–73 First Division 34 9 8 2 1 0 43 11 1973–74 First Division 42 12 3 1 1 0 46 13 Total 158 53 28 6 27 12 213 71 Liverpool 1974–75 First Division 25 5 0 0 8 5 33 10 1975–76 First Division 30 6 2 0 11 4 43 10 1976–77 First Division 41 7 8 1 12 1 61 9 1977–78 First Division 41 4 1 0 19 3 61 7 1978–79 First Division 42 10 7 1 5 0 54 11 1979–80 First Division 40 9 8 0 8 0 56 9 1980–81 First Division 41 8 2 1 19 4 62 13 1981–82 First Division 15 2 0 0 8 1 23 3 Total 275 51 28 3 90 18 393 72 Swansea City 1981–82 First Division 17 2 0 0 0 0 18 2 1982–83 First Division 21 0 0 0 7 0 28 0 1983–84 Second Division 3 0 0 0 2 0 5 0 Total 42 2 0 0 9 0 51 2 Hartlepool United 1983–84 Fourth Division 23 3 0 0 1 0 24 3 Career total 498 109 56 9 127 30 681 148 ===International=== Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals England 1976 4 1 1977 7 2 1978 0 0 1979 1 0 1980 5 0 Total 17 3 ==Honours== Arsenal *Inter-Cities Fairs Cup: 1970 *Football League First Division: 1970–71 *FA Cup: 1971;
